message:
The text of your comment is asking whether there's a difference in using `Task.Run` in the implementation. There is no performance difference, but I strongly prefer using `Task.Run` during invocation rather than implementation, because if you use it for implementation, then you end up with a `CalculateMandelbrotAsync` method that isn't *actually* asynchronous - it just synchronously runs on a thread pool thread. I call this "fake asynchrony", and [it's an antipattern](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/pfxteam/should-i-expose-asynchronous-wrappers-for-synchronous-methods/).

The example code of your comment is asking whether there's a difference using the `async`/`await` keywords in `MyButton_Click`. I cover this in more detail in my [eliding `async` post](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2016/12/eliding-async-await.html).
